four_laws_of_black_hole_thermodynamics.black_hole_version: Surface gravity κ is uniform over event horizon
four_laws_of_black_hole_thermodynamics.implication: Black holes are in thermal equilibrium
Energy conservation with horizon area as entropy proxy

four_laws_of_black_hole_thermodynamics.black_hole_version: Horizon area never decreases (dA ≥ 0) - Hawking's area theorem
four_laws_of_black_hole_thermodynamics.implication: Black holes only grow classically; quantum effects (Hawking radiation) allow shrinkage

four_laws_of_black_hole_thermodynamics.thermodynamic_analog: Cannot reach T = 0 in finite steps
four_laws_of_black_hole_thermodynamics.black_hole_version: Cannot reach κ = 0 (extremal black hole) in finite steps
four_laws_of_black_hole_thermodynamics.implication: Extremal black holes (M² = a² + Q²) are limiting cases

hawking_temperature.numerical: T_H ≈ 6 × 10⁻⁸ K for 1 solar mass (far colder than CMB)

evaporation_time.meaning: Stellar black holes last far longer than current universe age (10¹⁰ years)

planck_scale_connections.meaning: One bit per 4 Planck areas of horizon
Planck-mass black holes have near-Planck temperature

planck_scale_connections.issue: When M ~ m_P, quantum gravity takes over
planck_scale_connections.unknown: What happens at M ≈ m_P? Remnant? Complete evaporation?

information_paradox.description: If black holes evaporate completely via thermal radiation, what happens to information that fell in?
information_paradox.issue: Thermal radiation carries no information about what formed the black hole - violates unitarity
proposed_resolutions: Information escapes during evaporation (page curve, holography)
information_paradox.current_status: Still actively debated; evidence from AdS/CFT suggests information is preserved

definition.@value: The theoretical framework describing black holes as thermodynamic systems with temperature, entropy, and energy, governed by laws analogous to classical thermodynamics

related.relationship: Black hole entropy implies holographic bound
S_BH measured in Planck entropy units k_B

learning_objectives: State the four laws of black hole thermodynamics
Calculate Hawking temperature for given mass
Appreciate information paradox and open questions
common_errors: Thinking Hawking radiation comes from inside the horizon
Believing large black holes are hotter than small ones
Missing that stellar black holes are far colder than CMB
Thinking Hawking radiation has been observed
physics_insights: Black hole entropy is proportional to AREA, not volume - holographic!
1 solar mass black hole: T ≈ 60 nK, evaporates in 10⁶⁷ years
Entropy formula S = A/(4ℓ_P²) is the origin of holographic principle
Information paradox remains one of biggest open problems in physics
